column3: Aquavita was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

column2: Aquileia was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.
column3: Aquileia was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

column2: Aragon was one of the systems that formed a part of the region in the Deep Periphery known as Nueva Castile.
column3: Aragon was one of the systems that formed a part of the region in the Deep Periphery known as Nueva Castile.

column2: Arboris is the fifth planet of seven in the Arboris system and is a temperate world with three moons.
column3: Arboris is the fifth planet of seven in the Arboris system and is a temperate world with three moons.

column2: Arcadia is a temperate and somewhat habitable world that, in common with many other Clan worlds, has been held by - and contested by - several Clans at the same time for the majority of its history as a settled world.
column3: Arc-Royal system was originally a quiet, pastoral world; later the planet was a heavily-fortified world with a significant number of important industrial facilities.

column2: Arcadia (FS) was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.
column3: Arcadia is a temperate and somewhat habitable world that, in common with many other Clan worlds, has been held by - and contested by - several Clans at the same time for the majority of its history as a settled world.

column2: Strong in agriculture and manufacturing, Arcadia is nevertheless an awkwardly situated world with heavy gravity and planetary wide storms.
column3: Arcadia (FS) was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

column2: Arc-Royal system was originally a quiet, pastoral world; later the planet was a heavily-fortified world with a significant number of important industrial facilities.
column3: Strong in agriculture and manufacturing, Arcadia is nevertheless an awkwardly situated world with heavy gravity and planetary wide storms.

column2: The original Capital of the Lyran Commonwealth for centuries, the resulting population shift as inhabitants followed the capital to Tharkad has left a series of cities on the world that are vastly oversized for the current population.
column3: The original Capital of the Lyran Commonwealth for centuries, the resulting population shift as inhabitants followed the capital to Tharkad has left a series of cities on the world that are vastly oversized for the current population.

column2: The Ardoz system was settled during or soon after the First Exodus from Terra and by the end of the Age of War had been incorporated into the Draconis Combine.
column3: The Ardoz system was settled during or soon after the First Exodus from Terra and by the end of the Age of War had been incorporated into the Draconis Combine.

column2: Ares has been home to a number of various defense industries and is associated with the interstellar treaty called the Ares Convention.
column3: Ares has been home to a number of various defense industries and is associated with the interstellar treaty called the Ares Convention.

column2: The Arganda system was settled soon after the First Exodus from Terra and by the early twenty-fourth century the system was a part of the Federation of Skye. When the Lyran Commonwealth formed in 2341 the Arganda system became a part of that nation
column3: The Arganda system was settled soon after the First Exodus from Terra and by the early twenty-fourth century the system was a part of the Federation of Skye. When the Lyran Commonwealth formed in 2341 the Arganda system became a part of that nation

column2: The savannahs and deserts of Argos are dominated by native fauna, but a small network of hardy, fiercely independent townships have carved out a distinct culture in the temperate zone.
column3: The savannahs and deserts of Argos are dominated by native fauna, but a small network of hardy, fiercely independent townships have carved out a distinct culture in the temperate zone.

column2: Argyle is located near New Avalon, but wasn't settled until that world became too crowded. It quickly became one of the Crucis March's breadbasket worlds and exports a great deal of food to neighboring worlds, along with other manufactured goods.
column3: Argyle is located near New Avalon, but wasn't settled until that world became too crowded. It quickly became one of the Crucis March's breadbasket worlds and exports a great deal of food to neighboring worlds, along with other manufactured goods.

column2: Home to Toddlette Industries (now Earthwerks Incorporated), this high tech industrialised world is known for the production of the smallest BattleMech, the Flea.
column3: Home to Toddlette Industries (now Earthwerks Incorporated), this high tech industrialised world is known for the production of the smallest BattleMech, the Flea.

column2: Aristotle is notable for the large anarchist commune in residence on the planet, and the Commonwealth was more than happy to point to the technological backsliding of Aristotle as example to illustrate how useful central government was by comparison.
column3: Aristotle is notable for the large anarchist commune in residence on the planet, and the Commonwealth was more than happy to point to the technological backsliding of Aristotle as example to illustrate how useful central government was by comparison.

column2: The Arkab system was settled at some point prior to the end of the Reunification War by a large muslim population. The vast deserts of Arkab are mineral rich, and the planet is home to Cairo Enterprises, the manufacturer of the Sand Devil hovertank.
column3: The Arkab system was settled at some point prior to the end of the Reunification War by a large muslim population. The vast deserts of Arkab are mineral rich, and the planet is home to Cairo Enterprises, the manufacturer of the Sand Devil hovertank.

column2: Arlanda was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.
column3: Arlanda was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

column2: The Arlington system was colonized during the First Exodus from Terra, and was home to an SLDF garrison in the final years of the Star League. A ruined but intact Castle Brian still stands firm amidst the undergrowth.
column3: The Arlington system was colonized during the First Exodus from Terra, and was home to an SLDF garrison in the final years of the Star League. A ruined but intact Castle Brian still stands firm amidst the undergrowth.

column2: Arluna is a temperate world with vast jungles and an abundance of native life. Once the site of ancient battles, nature has reclaimed the old fortifications and cities.
column3: Arluna is a temperate world with vast jungles and an abundance of native life. Once the site of ancient battles, nature has reclaimed the old fortifications and cities.

column2: The Armaxa system was colonized during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War, and in 3029 became part of the newly formed St. Ives Compact.
column3: The Armaxa system was colonized during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War, and in 3029 became part of the newly formed St. Ives Compact.

column2: The Armington system was settled at some point during or prior to the Age of War and was part of the growing Taurian Concordat at the time.
column3: The Armington system was settled at some point during or prior to the Age of War and was part of the growing Taurian Concordat at the time.

column2: Armstrong was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.
column3: Armstrong was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

column3: Arn (Jia Tian 3130+) was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

column2: The Arnaudville system was colonized during the Star League era and has been one of the great exporters of pasturised milk to the milk drinkers in the Federated Suns for centuries. Milk barons rule here.
column3: The Arnaudville system was colonized during the Star League era and has been one of the great exporters of pasturised milk to the milk drinkers in the Federated Suns for centuries. Milk barons rule here.

column2: Arromanches was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.
column3: Arromanches was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

column2: Artru is a barren, icy rock with almost nothing of value; a token staff keeps the massive industrial mining equipment running. It's a major travel link to Hellespont, however, and Hellespont is the headquarters of the rimward branch of the ComStar Explorer Corps.
column3: Artru is a barren, icy rock with almost nothing of value; a token staff keeps the massive industrial mining equipment running. It's a major travel link to Hellespont, however, and Hellespont is the headquarters of the rimward branch of the ComStar Explorer Corps.

column3: Artru is a barren, icy rock with almost nothing of value; a token staff keeps the massive industrial mining equipment running. It's a major travel link to Hellespont, however, and Hellespont is the headquarters of the rimward branch of the ComStar Explorer Corps.

column2: Arundel was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.
column3: Arundel was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

column2: Ascella is a young, warm planet with no moons. Home to a small industry that produces fusion and electrical plants for civilian and light military vehicles, it also exported large amounts of radioactive materials and heavy metals.
column3: Ascella is a young, warm planet with no moons. Home to a small industry that produces fusion and electrical plants for civilian and light military vehicles, it also exported large amounts of radioactive materials and heavy metals.

column2: Known as the north Donkey of the Cancer constellation in Old Terran, the Asellus Australis system was settled during the First Exodus from Terra.
column3: Known as the north Donkey of the Cancer constellation in Old Terran, the Asellus Australis system was settled during the First Exodus from Terra.

column2: Known as the south Donkey of the Cancer constellation in Old Terran, the Asellus Borealis system was settled during the First Exodus from Terra.
column3: Known as the south Donkey of the Cancer constellation in Old Terran, the Asellus Borealis system was settled during the First Exodus from Terra.

column2: Asgard was one of the first planets colonised, and was part of the original Terran Alliance.  The population have always been reluctant members of the Combine, in spite of generations of brainwashing.
column3: Asgard was one of the first planets colonised, and was part of the original Terran Alliance. The population have always been reluctant members of the Combine, in spite of generations of brainwashing.

column2: Ashburton is a minor planet in the FWL, known for it's somewhat excentric orbit which produces seasonal extremes and wild weather.  It also houses Ashburton Prison, one of the largest prisons in the FWL.
column3: Ashburton is a minor planet in the FWL, known for it's somewhat excentric orbit which produces seasonal extremes and wild weather. It also houses Ashburton Prison, one of the largest prisons in the FWL.

column2: Ashio has a native species which resembles an elephant-sized cow and which is farmed for meat that is almost indistinguishable from Terran beef, making it one of the Inner Sphere's primary beef exporters. The drug Brace is rumoured to be made here.
column3: Ashio has a native species which resembles an elephant-sized cow and which is farmed for meat that is almost indistinguishable from Terran beef, making it one of the Inner Sphere's primary beef exporters. The drug Brace is rumoured to be made here.

column2: Ashkum is a minor planet on the Fed/Capellan border.  Recently conquered by the Feds, it remains a typical \"border world\" - underdeveloped and over garisoned.
column3: Ashkum is a minor planet on the Fed/Capellan border. Recently conquered by the Feds, it remains a typical "border world" - underdeveloped and over garisoned.

column2: Ashley is an unremarkable self-sufficient planet, notable only because Prince David Varney was killed in a riot here during the Davion Civil Wars.
column3: Ashley is an unremarkable self-sufficient planet, notable only because Prince David Varney was killed in a riot here during the Davion Civil Wars.

column2: A former colony of the  Magistracy of Canopus, this planet was taken over by SLDF forces in 2580 and annexed to the FWL.  The planet itself has significant petrochemical reserves being tapped by several operations.
column3: A former colony of the Magistracy of Canopus, this planet was taken over by SLDF forces in 2580 and annexed to the FWL. The planet itself has significant petrochemical reserves being tapped by several operations.

column2: As Samik was one of the three worlds settled at the same time that formed the nucleus of what become the 17-world United Hindu Collective, which existed for centuries before being absorbed by the Federated Suns.
column3: As Samik was one of the three worlds settled at the same time that formed the nucleus of what become the 17-world United Hindu Collective, which existed for centuries before being absorbed by the Federated Suns.

column2: Recently taken from the Combine, Asta is a world that refuses to die, in spite of being ravaged by WMD in the days of the Amaris Empire, and being a battleground recently.  It is a highly agrarian \"breadbasket\" planet.
column3: Недавно приобретённый Синдикатом Дракона, Аста - это мир, который отказывается погибать, несмотря на то, что он жестоко пострадал от применения оружия массового поражения во времена Империи Амариса, а так же после недавних сражений. Это очень аграрная планета - «житница».

column2: Astrokaszy is hot, dry and windswept despite having a large amount of water. Treasure hunters are still drawn to the planet by rumors of a Star League Defense Force cache of precious metals, hidden during the Reunification War.
column3: Astrokaszy is hot, dry and windswept despite having a large amount of water. Treasure hunters are still drawn to the planet by rumors of a Star League Defense Force cache of precious metals, hidden during the Reunification War.

column2: Asturias is the fifth planet in the Asturias system and for centuries served as the capital of the Castilian Principalities. Asturias was home to one of the few defense industries to be found within Nueva Castile, namely Sanctuary Station.
column3: Астурия, пятая планета в системе Астурии, на протяжении веков служила столицей Кастильских княжеств. Астурия была родиной одной из немногих оборонных отраслей промышленности Новой Кастилии - базы Святилище.

column2: Asuncion is a mineral rich world that is home to Asuncion Industries, a manufacturer that produces small spacecraft and personal vacuum environment survival equipment.
column3: Asuncion is a mineral rich world that is home to Asuncion Industries, a manufacturer that produces small spacecraft and personal vacuum environment survival equipment.

column2: Athenry is notable for the fact that almost every plant on this predominantly water planet has a medicinal value, and for the ruins of an earlier civilisation found near the capital.
column3: Athenry is notable for the fact that almost every plant on this predominantly water planet has a medicinal value, and for the ruins of an earlier civilisation found near the capital.

column2: Athna of the low albedo was established as a graphite mine before being all but abandoned by the Liao after a rebellion. But some of the old domes remain unshattered and scavengers of all sorts can be found within.
column3: Athna of the low albedo was established as a graphite mine before being all but abandoned by the Liao after a rebellion. But some of the old domes remain unshattered and scavengers of all sorts can be found within.

column2: Atlas is a marginal system, remarkable only for the ruins of a primitive pre-space civilisation dotted around the planet, and for Atlas Prison, one of the larger facilities in Commonwealth space.
column3: Atlas is a marginal system, remarkable only for the ruins of a primitive pre-space civilisation dotted around the planet, and for Atlas Prison, one of the larger facilities in Commonwealth space.

column2: Atocongo is an unimportant little world on the edge of Lyran space.
column3: Atocongo is an unimportant little world on the edge of Lyran space.

column2: Atreus is a clan homeworld.  Yes, that's right, you shouldn't be here, and will probably die.  This has been a community service announcement.
column3: Atreus is a clan homeworld. Yes, that's right, you shouldn't be here, and will probably die. This has been a community service announcement.

column2: Atreus for centuries served as the capital of the Free Worlds League. Atreus is home to a number of important defense industry facilities and is notable for being the location of the headquarters of SAFE, the League intelligence agency.
column3: Атреус на протяжении веков был столицей Лиги Свободных Миров. Атреус является домом для ряда важных объектов оборонной промышленности и примечателен тем, что здесь находится штаб-квартира SAFE, разведывательного агентства Лиги.

column2: A pleasant world in the heart of the Concordat, Atreus Prime was scarred by an ancient battle between the SLDF and Taurian rebels, well before the Amaris Civil War. A swath of the planet is a barren radioactive wasteland, littered with the shells of dead 'Mechs.
column3: A pleasant world in the heart of the Concordat, Atreus Prime was scarred by an ancient battle between the SLDF and Taurian rebels, well before the Amaris Civil War. A swath of the planet is a barren radioactive wasteland, littered with the shells of dead 'Mechs.

column2: Now a tropical water world with little to recommend it, Atria was first occupied during the Terran Exodus.  Limited resources, and only survives because of tourism.
column3: Now a tropical water world with little to recommend it, Atria was first occupied during the Terran Exodus. Limited resources, and only survives because of tourism.

column2: Atsugi is a self-sufficient but otherwise unremarkable world colonised by the FWL early in the 26th Century.
column3: Atsugi is a self-sufficient but otherwise unremarkable world colonised by the FWL early in the 26th Century.

column2: %%SURVEY INFORMATION CORRUPT%%
column3: %%SURVEY INFORMATION CORRUPT%%

column2: Atzenbrugg is a minimally habitable world with an atmosphere that is breathable with no more than a basic pollen filter, it is regarded as tainted due to the fact that almost all the native life contains varying degrees of hallucinagens.
column3: Atzenbrugg is a minimally habitable world with an atmosphere that is breathable with no more than a basic pollen filter, it is regarded as tainted due to the fact that almost all the native life contains varying degrees of hallucinagens.

column2: Aubisson, due to being a moderately important agricultural and manufacturing world on the Combine/Commonwealth border, has changed hands numerous times through it's history.  Recently \"reclaimed\" from the Commonwealth, for now...
column3: Aubisson, due to being a moderately important agricultural and manufacturing world on the Combine/Commonwealth border, has changed hands numerous times through it's history. Recently "reclaimed" from the Commonwealth, for now...

column2: An unremarkable, self-sufficient planet only notable because the Capellan's seem to have an interest in it.  Aucara seems to have an unusual amount of \"alleged\" Maskirovka agents captured on it - which the Capellans deny.
column3: An unremarkable, self-sufficient planet only notable because the Capellan's seem to have an interest in it. Aucara seems to have an unusual amount of "alleged" Maskirovka agents captured on it - which the Capellans deny.

column2: August was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.
column3: August was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

column2: Augusta itself is a modest planet with no real benefits apart from a breathable atmosphere, however the other 7 planets in the system house a wealth of minerals which support a thriving manufacuring base.
column3: Augusta itself is a modest planet with no real benefits apart from a breathable atmosphere, however the other 7 planets in the system house a wealth of minerals which support a thriving manufacuring base.

column2: Originally settled by Jesuits, during the Succession Wars most of the population was killed or driven offworld. A warm, pleasant world, it has seen much of the population loss reversed in the thirty-first century as new immigrants arrived.
column3: Originally settled by Jesuits, during the Succession Wars most of the population was killed or driven offworld. A warm, pleasant world, it has seen much of the population loss reversed in the thirty-first century as new immigrants arrived.

column2: A hot and humid world famed for its many rivers and swamps, as well as its dark damp forests. Auldhouse is home to a vast quantity of unique native fauna which Kodiak Pharmaceuticals often tries to exploit.
column3: A hot and humid world famed for its many rivers and swamps, as well as its dark damp forests. Auldhouse is home to a vast quantity of unique native fauna which Kodiak Pharmaceuticals often tries to exploit.

column2: A large temperate world with large amounts of mineral riches, Aur is a gem of the Commonwealth. Home to Edasich Motors, a major manufacturer of Fusion Engines, as well as Interstellar Expeditions.
column3: A large temperate world with large amounts of mineral riches, Aur is a gem of the Commonwealth. Home to Edasich Motors, a major manufacturer of Fusion Engines, as well as Interstellar Expeditions.

column2: Austerlitz (Scauld 3130+) was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.
column3: Austerlitz (Scauld 3130+) was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

column2: Australia is vitally important to the Lyran state despite its unimportant location and relative lack of resources. It is the home of one of the Commonwealth's Mint and Reserve Banks, making it a vital financial center.
column3: Australia is vitally important to the Lyran state despite its unimportant location and relative lack of resources. It is the home of one of the Commonwealth's Mint and Reserve Banks, making it a vital financial center.

column2: A warm garden planet that caters to vacationers, Autumn Wind is a popular spot for the richer citizens in the Free Worlds.
column3: A warm garden planet that caters to vacationers, Autumn Wind is a popular spot for the richer citizens in the Free Worlds.

column2: Avawatz is a planet-wide ocean. Gigantic scintillating creatures live in the ocean, moving slowly by using their siphons. Day and night rapidly follow on from each other.
column3: Avawatz is a planet-wide ocean. Gigantic scintillating creatures live in the ocean, moving slowly by using their siphons. Day and night rapidly follow on from each other.

column2: Avellaneda was first colonised by a mostly Argentinian population during the First Exodus from Terra.  This warm, mountainous planet is noted in that it contains ruins of a previous pre-spaceflight civilisation.
column3: Avellaneda was first colonised by a mostly Argentinian population during the First Exodus from Terra. This warm, mountainous planet is noted in that it contains ruins of a previous pre-spaceflight civilisation.

column2: Avigait is notable in that it's dominant fungal lifeform seems to have developed a rudimentary intelligence.  For no explicable reason, the fungus seems to avoid growing near Human habitations.  Currently being studied.
column3: Avigait is notable in that it's dominant fungal lifeform seems to have developed a rudimentary intelligence. For no explicable reason, the fungus seems to avoid growing near Human habitations. Currently being studied.

column2: The Avior system was colonized during the First Exodus from Terra and was incorporated into the Principality of Regulus prior to the formation of the Free Worlds League.
column3: The Avior system was colonized during the First Exodus from Terra and was incorporated into the Principality of Regulus prior to the formation of the Free Worlds League.

column2: Avon is the fifth planet in the Avon system. The surface of Avon is host to at least two significant defense manufacturers, with Matabushi Incorporation producing DropShip parts for the Combine.
column3: Avon is the fifth planet in the Avon system. The surface of Avon is host to at least two significant defense manufacturers, with Matabushi Incorporation producing DropShip parts for the Combine.

column2: The Avranches system was colonized by the Draconis Combine at some point in the Star League era after the end of the Reunification War but was destroyed in the First Succession War. A recent colonisation effort failed due to the Third Succession War.
column3: The Avranches system was colonized by the Draconis Combine at some point in the Star League era after the end of the Reunification War but was destroyed in the First Succession War. A recent colonisation effort failed due to the Third Succession War.

column2: Awano was the headquarters of the XIV Corps (Star League) of the Star League Defense Force centuries ago, and caches are found regularly on the world in less habitable areas.
column3: Awano was the headquarters of the XIV Corps (Star League) of the Star League Defense Force centuries ago, and caches are found regularly on the world in less habitable areas.

column2: Awyron was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.
column3: Awyron was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

column2: Axton is the third planet in the Axton system and has been host to both an industrial facility belonging to Wangker Aerospace and a training facility operated by the New Avalon Institute of Science. Axton has two moons named Greenbacck and Jeremiah.
column3: Axton is the third planet in the Axton system and has been host to both an industrial facility belonging to Wangker Aerospace and a training facility operated by the New Avalon Institute of Science. Axton has two moons named Greenbacck and Jeremiah.

column2: This system is home to a mineral rich but cold arctic world named Ayacucho.
column3: This system is home to a mineral rich but cold arctic world named Ayacucho.

column2: Aylmer was colonized during the Star League era at some point after the Reunification War, it's ammonia rich soils belie the otherwise barren grey and rocky nature of this world.
column3: Aylmer was colonized during the Star League era at some point after the Reunification War, it's ammonia rich soils belie the otherwise barren grey and rocky nature of this world.

column2: Ayn Tarma is often described in Colonist's Brochures as a \"lucrative mining world\" - without mentioning that it is vitally dependent on a lifeline of iceships supplied by Curtiss Hydrosystems - the cost of which is enormous.
column3: Ayn Tarma is often described in Colonist's Brochures as a "lucrative mining world" - without mentioning that it is vitally dependent on a lifeline of iceships supplied by Curtiss Hydrosystems - the cost of which is enormous.

column2: Azha is important to the CCAF as it possesses an excellent strategic location. The near desert environment makes it difficult to farm, but the vast stores of minerals and metals beneath the surface have given birth to a thriving electronics industry.
column3: Azha is important to the CCAF as it possesses an excellent strategic location. The near desert environment makes it difficult to farm, but the vast stores of minerals and metals beneath the surface have given birth to a thriving electronics industry.

column2: Azur was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.
column3: Azur was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

column2: While habitable and habitated, Babaeski's complete lack of anything remarkable has spared it from conflict, in spite of being a border world.
column3: While habitable and habitated, Babaeski's complete lack of anything remarkable has spared it from conflict, in spite of being a border world.

column2: A barely inhabited water planet on the fringe of Combine space.  Population is limited to the few islands that rise above the ocean.
column3: A barely inhabited water planet on the fringe of Combine space. Population is limited to the few islands that rise above the ocean.

column2: Somehow, you made it to the deep periphery, and into the heart of Clan territory.  Perhaps you should GTFO before they notice you?
column3: Каким-то образом вы добрались сквозь глубокую Периферию до сердца территории кланов. Возможно, вам стоит уёбывать и поскорей, пока они вас не заметили.

column2: An insignificant ball of dirt at the edge of known space.  The only notable thing about this that the habitable zone where Baccalieu orbits is very close to the tiny main-sequence star of the system.
column3: An insignificant ball of dirt at the edge of known space. The only notable thing about this that the habitable zone where Baccalieu orbits is very close to the tiny main-sequence star of the system.

column2: Originally a Capellan world, Bacum has been under Federated control for the last 200 years.  This isn't likely to change, as there is little to make Bacum significant save it's limited production of a particularly fine wine from native berries.
column3: Originally a Capellan world, Bacum has been under Federated control for the last 200 years. This isn't likely to change, as there is little to make Bacum significant save it's limited production of a particularly fine wine from native berries.

column2: A small marginal Martian like planet with negligable resources, formerly claimed by the Taurian Concordant, but most recently little more than a pirate enclave.
column3: A small marginal Martian like planet with negligable resources, formerly claimed by the Taurian Concordant, but most recently little more than a pirate enclave.

column2: A moderately populated manufacturing and mining world, Bad News has been under Kurita Control for almost 500 years.  Currently home to the Nineteenth Galedon Regulars.
column3: A moderately populated manufacturing and mining world, Bad News has been under Kurita Control for almost 500 years. Currently home to the Nineteenth Galedon Regulars.

column2: Briefly colonised and claimed by both the Rim Worlds Republic and the Lyrans, Baggville now lies abandoned due to limited resources
column3: Briefly colonised and claimed by both the Rim Worlds Republic and the Lyrans, Baggville now lies abandoned due to limited resources

column2: Colonised by the Feds around 2750, Bahl's Retreat was abandoned some 100 years later.
column3: Colonised by the Feds around 2750, Bahl's Retreat was abandoned some 100 years later.

column2: A moderatrely industrialised agricultural planet, originally colonised during the First Exodus from Terra.
column3: A moderatrely industrialised agricultural planet, originally colonised during the First Exodus from Terra.

column2: This agricultural world is otherwise unremarkable apart from being the former headquarters of Baker Phamacuticals prior to it's recent aquisition by Nashan Pharmaceuticals.
column3: This agricultural world is otherwise unremarkable apart from being the former headquarters of Baker Phamacuticals prior to it's recent aquisition by Nashan Pharmaceuticals.

column2: Long ago, frozen Balawat was struck by a meteor that dug a hole deep in the planet's crust, letting shine its inner light. Now, only in this giant crater, life thrives, including a single large Magistracy port initially established as an art colony and since maintained by the mining industry.
column3: Long ago, frozen Balawat was struck by a meteor that dug a hole deep in the planet's crust, letting shine its inner light. Now, only in this giant crater, life thrives, including a single large Magistracy port initially established as an art colony and since maintained by the mining industry.

column2: A typical self sufficient world, only noteworthy because it is the home of the Combine's Second Sword of Light, one of the most presigious units in the DCMS.
column3: A typical self sufficient world, only noteworthy because it is the home of the Combine's Second Sword of Light, one of the most presigious units in the DCMS.

column2: Baliggora is the regional capital of the Baliggora Outworld Province, and apart from the presence of a minor ComStar base, is a typical Rimward world.  Most of the population is concentrated around the slightly warmer equitorial band.
column3: Baliggora is the regional capital of the Baliggora Outworld Province, and apart from the presence of a minor ComStar base, is a typical Rimward world. Most of the population is concentrated around the slightly warmer equitorial band.

column2: Balkan was always listed in early Lyran charts as \"Marginally Habitable\".  When the Combine captured it during the 3rd succession war, they soon discovered what a drain on resorces it was, and abandoned it shortly thereafter.
column3: Balkan was always listed in early Lyran charts as "Marginally Habitable". When the Combine captured it during the 3rd succession war, they soon discovered what a drain on resorces it was, and abandoned it shortly thereafter.

column2: The Ballad system is an anomaly.  Right on the very edge of known space, is a reasonably habitable system - but populations placed here inexplicably fail to thrive.  The Canopians are currently funding research into this.
column3: The Ballad system is an anomaly. Right on the very edge of known space, is a reasonably habitable system - but populations placed here inexplicably fail to thrive. The Canopians are currently funding research into this.

column2: One of the more important Hegemony planets, Ballalaba's high concentration of heavy metal deposits have given rise to an extensive mining industry, in spite of it's extensive volcanisation.
column3: One of the more important Hegemony planets, Ballalaba's high concentration of heavy metal deposits have given rise to an extensive mining industry, in spite of it's extensive volcanisation.

column2: A former Federated Suns world that suffered extensive infrastructure damage during the First Succession War, it now lays abandoned save for the occasional independant mining operation, and pirates of course.
column3: A former Federated Suns world that suffered extensive infrastructure damage during the First Succession War, it now lays abandoned save for the occasional independant mining operation, and pirates of course.

column2: Another \"quiet and unremarkable\" Lyran world, known for it's large areas of strong but slow growing native trees, the production of a particularly smooth single malt whisky, and a native fish similar to the sardine that grows to weigh 600lb.
column3: Another "quiet and unremarkable" Lyran world, known for it's large areas of strong but slow growing native trees, the production of a particularly smooth single malt whisky, and a native fish similar to the sardine that grows to weigh 600lb.

column2: The primarily Scandinavian population of this system have recently become part of the Rassalhague Republic, and have already geared up production of moderately priced flat-packed furniture and mech parts.
column3: The primarily Scandinavian population of this system have recently become part of the Rassalhague Republic, and have already geared up production of moderately priced flat-packed furniture and mech parts.

column2: This former Taurean system has long been abandoned due to limited resources and an almost non-existant atmosphere.
column3: This former Taurean system has long been abandoned due to limited resources and an almost non-existant atmosphere.

column2: Briefly colonised by the Federated Suns after the Reunification War, Banberg was quickly abandoned and now serves as little more than a hole-in-the-wall for pirates escaping local authorities.
column3: Briefly colonised by the Federated Suns after the Reunification War, Banberg was quickly abandoned and now serves as little more than a hole-in-the-wall for pirates escaping local authorities.

column2: One of the founding systems of the Capellan Co-Prosperity Sphere, Bandora has remained in Capellan hands for it's entire history.  Bandora has a little of everything, and remains an important part of the Confederation.
column3: One of the founding systems of the Capellan Co-Prosperity Sphere, Bandora has remained in Capellan hands for it's entire history. Bandora has a little of everything, and remains an important part of the Confederation.

column2: The Banfora system was colonised at some point after the end of the Reunification War. Shortly after it was captured by the FWL from the Capellans during the Succession Wars, Banfora was abandoned.
column3: The Banfora system was colonised at some point after the end of the Reunification War. Shortly after it was captured by the FWL from the Capellans during the Succession Wars, Banfora was abandoned.

column2: Deep in Combine space, Bangor has remained an important mining and manufacturing planet since Star League times.  Rumors still claim there is an untouched SLDF cache somewher on the planet, although officially none has never been found.
column3: Deep in Combine space, Bangor has remained an important mining and manufacturing planet since Star League times. Rumors still claim there is an untouched SLDF cache somewher on the planet, although officially none has never been found.

column2: A Garden Planet deep in Combine space, known for it's wide variety of Terran and non-Terran produce.
column3: A Garden Planet deep in Combine space, known for it's wide variety of Terran and non-Terran produce.

column2: Colonised during the Star League Era, Bannerhoft was once a major population centre.  However, the collapse of the Star League lead to extensive pirate and slaver raids, and by the end of the First Succession War it was abandoned.
column3: Colonised during the Star League Era, Bannerhoft was once a major population centre. However, the collapse of the Star League lead to extensive pirate and slaver raids, and by the end of the First Succession War it was abandoned.

column2: The Banori system is home to a centuries old Outworlds Alliance colony. Once invaded by the SLDF, they managed to stave off numerous assaults to retain their independence.
column3: The Banori system is home to a centuries old Outworlds Alliance colony. Once invaded by the SLDF, they managed to stave off numerous assaults to retain their independence.

column2: Barahona was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.
column3: Barahona was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

column2: The Baranda system is located in the June Operational Area of the Periphery March of the Federated Suns. The Baranda system was colonized during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War.
column3: The Baranda system is located in the June Operational Area of the Periphery March of the Federated Suns. The Baranda system was colonized during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War.

column2: Barcella is an early Kerensky Cluster colony world. The planet became the capital of Clan Nova Cat. It was later colonized by other Clans in the following years, however the Nova Cats hold a large percentage of this world.
column3: Barcella is an early Kerensky Cluster colony world. The planet became the capital of Clan Nova Cat. It was later colonized by other Clans in the following years, however the Nova Cats hold a large percentage of this world.

column2: Originally intended by the Rim Worlds Republic to be a \"hedgehog\", a giant fortified firebase that Republican forces could use to slow the advance of any invading force, most fortifications were decimated during the Reunification War.
column3: Originally intended by the Rim Worlds Republic to be a "hedgehog", a giant fortified firebase that Republican forces could use to slow the advance of any invading force, most fortifications were decimated during the Reunification War.

column2: The Barlaston system was colonised during the First Exodus from Terra, and is named after the Barlaston family holdings, who own most of the utilities on the surface.
column3: The Barlaston system was colonised during the First Exodus from Terra, and is named after the Barlaston family holdings, who own most of the utilities on the surface.

column2: Once the planet's capital city was a sprawling network of tunnels and hab domes in a mega-city named Rough Patch. Only in the past century has terraforming progressed enough to allow colonists on the surface.
column3: Once the planet's capital city was a sprawling network of tunnels and hab domes in a mega-city named Rough Patch. Only in the past century has terraforming progressed enough to allow colonists on the surface.

column2: With a population of nearly 3.5 billion and a thriving trade economy, Barras is a critical link between the Capellans and the League. As a consequence, it is also a hotbed of intrigue and espionage.
column3: With a population of nearly 3.5 billion and a thriving trade economy, Barras is a critical link between the Capellans and the League. As a consequence, it is also a hotbed of intrigue and espionage.

column2: Barstow's population was almost wiped out entirely during the First Succession War in a combined Nuclear, Biological and Chemical weapons attack. The tainted atmosphere still persists to this day.
column3: Barstow's population was almost wiped out entirely during the First Succession War in a combined Nuclear, Biological and Chemical weapons attack. The tainted atmosphere still persists to this day.

column2: Bartrock was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.
column3: Bartrock was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

column2: The Baruun Urt system was colonised during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War. It's vast steppes and high gravity breed strong large plains horses which are exported to farmlands across the sector.
column3: The Baruun Urt system was colonised during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War. It's vast steppes and high gravity breed strong large plains horses which are exported to farmlands across the sector.

column2: The Baryshevo system was colonised during the Star League era at the end of the Reunification War. The Brunswick family has ruled this planet for many generations, serving the LCAF as a reinforced regiment.
column3: The Baryshevo system was colonised during the Star League era at the end of the Reunification War. The Brunswick family has ruled this planet for many generations, serving the LCAF as a reinforced regiment.

column2: Basalt was one of the first worlds settled by explorers from the Terran Hegemony. Despite the high gravity, incredible air pressure, and wild weather, the world has long been a source of excellent raw materials.
column3: Basalt was one of the first worlds settled by explorers from the Terran Hegemony. Despite the high gravity, incredible air pressure, and wild weather, the world has long been a source of excellent raw materials.

column2: Settled during the first Terran Exodus alongside Panpour and As Samik, Basantapur became the capital of the Collective and gave its name to the treaty that saw the Collective incorporated as a semi-autonomous member of the Federated Suns in 2540.
column3: Settled during the first Terran Exodus alongside Panpour and As Samik, Basantapur became the capital of the Collective and gave its name to the treaty that saw the Collective incorporated as a semi-autonomous member of the Federated Suns in 2540.

column2: Basiliano's location on the border between the Draconis Combine and Lyran Commonwealth gives the small, water-poor world a far greater significance to the Draconis Combine than any inherent worth in the planet itself.
column3: Basiliano's location on the border between the Draconis Combine and Lyran Commonwealth gives the small, water-poor world a far greater significance to the Draconis Combine than any inherent worth in the planet itself.

column2: Bass has an excentric orbit, which results in temps varying seasonally up to +/- 70° from a mean of just 5°C.  Most dwellings are in disused mining shafts, including the \"Dungeons\" - one of Bass's more popular tourist spots for BDSM practitioners.
column3: Bass has an excentric orbit, which results in temps varying seasonally up to +/- 70° from a mean of just 5°C. Most dwellings are in disused mining shafts, including the "Dungeons" - one of Bass's more popular tourist spots for BDSM practitioners.

column2: Bassfield is predominately a water world, and boasts some of the most obscure species of fish in known space. It's widely scattered, populated island chains are separated by deep oceans.
column3: Bassfield is predominately a water world, and boasts some of the most obscure species of fish in known space. It's widely scattered, populated island chains are separated by deep oceans.

column2: The Bastian system was located in the Chirikof Operational Area of the Crucis March within the Federated Suns, close to the Reisterstown and Steeles systems. The Bastian system was settled during the First Exodus from Terra.
column3: The Bastian system was located in the Chirikof Operational Area of the Crucis March within the Federated Suns, close to the Reisterstown and Steeles systems. The Bastian system was settled during the First Exodus from Terra.

column2: The Bastrop system was located in the Woodbine Operational Area of the Periphery March within the Federated Suns.  Originally part of the Outworlds Alliance, it was ceded to the Federated Suns during the early years of the Succession Wars.
column3: The Bastrop system was located in the Woodbine Operational Area of the Periphery March within the Federated Suns. Originally part of the Outworlds Alliance, it was ceded to the Federated Suns during the early years of the Succession Wars.

column2: The Batajnica system was the location of at least one habitable world in the Buena Province of the Lyran Commonwealth.
column3: The Batajnica system was the location of at least one habitable world in the Buena Province of the Lyran Commonwealth.

column2: The Batavia system was the location of at least one habitable world and is located in the Markesan Operational Area of the Crucis March within the Federated Suns.
column3: The Batavia system was the location of at least one habitable world and is located in the Markesan Operational Area of the Crucis March within the Federated Suns.

column2: Battaraigi was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

column2: One of the poorest and most ignorant worlds in the Davion realm, Baxley contributes more recruits to ComStar than any other world in the Federated Suns, the impoverished and uneducated population seeing the Blessed Order's representives as near gods.
column3: One of the poorest and most ignorant worlds in the Davion realm, Baxley contributes more recruits to ComStar than any other world in the Federated Suns, the impoverished and uneducated population seeing the Blessed Order's representives as near gods.

column2: Baxter is a world that experiences earthquakes and dust storms nearly every day. The resulting tidal stresses caused a great deal of upheaval in Baxter's ecosphere, with much of the land on the planet becoming desert by the thirty-first century.
column3: Baxter is a world that experiences earthquakes and dust storms nearly every day. The resulting tidal stresses caused a great deal of upheaval in Baxter's ecosphere, with much of the land on the planet becoming desert by the thirty-first century.

column2: In the final years of the Star League, Bayindir hosted a SLDF base, Fort Gates, where the 58th BattleMech Division operated. The unit was successful in defending the world from multiple pirate attacks. The ruins can still be seen to this day.

column2: The Beaumont system was colonized during the Star League era during the buildup to the Reunification War, and fortified rapidly with a Castle Brian, whose ruins now stand looking over Beauchamp City.

column3: Beckars was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

column2: One of five worlds to be a part of the Stewart Confederation, Bedeque suffered immensely following the withdrawal of Terran authority in the 23rd Century. Statues to David Genovese, saviour of the planet, still stand today across the surface.
column3: One of five worlds to be a part of the Stewart Confederation, Bedeque suffered immensely following the withdrawal of Terran authority in the 23rd Century. Statues to David Genovese, saviour of the planet, still stand today across the surface.

column3: A tropical world with numerous pharmaceutical industries, Beecher still has hidden ruins and depots dotting the surface from the First Succession War.

column2: The Beehive Cluster is a stellar cluster containing hundreds of stars and is located a little over 800 light-years from Terra. The Beehive Cluster lies on theborder of the huge Perseus-Cepherus Cloud Complex and is still largely unexplored.

column3: The Beenleigh system was colonised by the Federated Suns during the Star League era. A quiet, peaceful little world in a galaxy full of strife.

column2: Another non-descript planet in a galaxy of more interesting planets, Beid is remarkable only by the size of the trees in it's tropical forests.
column3: Another non-descript planet in a galaxy of more interesting planets, Beid is remarkable only by the size of the trees in it's tropical forests.

column2: This Federation planet is known for it's quirky designations for it's planetary government.  The planetary leader is known as the \"Prince\", although the title is elected and has nothing to do with any royal lineage.
column3: This Federation planet is known for it's quirky designations for it's planetary government. The planetary leader is known as the "Prince", although the title is elected and has nothing to do with any royal lineage.

column2: One of the 12 habitable planets of the New Delphi Compact, Belgae is an agricultural planet with a low technological dependancy, in accordance with the Omniss anti-tech philosophy of the region.
column3: One of the 12 habitable planets of the New Delphi Compact, Belgae is an agricultural planet with a low technological dependancy, in accordance with the Omniss anti-tech philosophy of the region.

column2: Bell X - more commonly known simply as Bell. Bell has been contested repeatedly during its history as an inhabited world and has been home to significant defense manufacturing facilities. The population was wiped out in 2358 and has been rebuilt.
column3: Bell X - more commonly known simply as Bell. Bell has been contested repeatedly during its history as an inhabited world and has been home to significant defense manufacturing facilities. The population was wiped out in 2358 and has been rebuilt.

column3: Bell (OA) was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

column2: A non-descript border world between the LC and the FWL, Bella has seen it's share of battles over the centuries.  Due to this, there iws little manufacturing infrastructure on the world, in spite of reasonable mineral reserves.
column3: A non-descript border world between the LC and the FWL, Bella has seen it's share of battles over the centuries. Due to this, there iws little manufacturing infrastructure on the world, in spite of reasonable mineral reserves.

column2: The Belladonna system was colonized during the First Exodus from Terra or shortly after. It houses a major industrial facility for Cal-Boeing.
column3: The Belladonna system was colonized during the First Exodus from Terra or shortly after. It houses a major industrial facility for Cal-Boeing.

column2: Bellatrix has a long and proud history, having been settled in the First Exodus. The system was briefly captured by the Free Worlds League during the Star League era, but was retaken by mercenaries employed by the Capellan Confederation.
column3: Bellatrix has a long and proud history, having been settled in the First Exodus. The system was briefly captured by the Free Worlds League during the Star League era, but was retaken by mercenaries employed by the Capellan Confederation.

column2: Recently settled after the Fourth Succession War, Belle Isle is a small agricultural colony set up amongst a water world.
column3: Recently settled after the Fourth Succession War, Belle Isle is a small agricultural colony set up amongst a water world.

column2: Recently liberated from mercenaries and religious fanatics, lightly-inhabited Bellerophon is arid and inhospitable, and conflicts over limited agricultural resources are common.
column3: Recently liberated from mercenaries and religious fanatics, lightly-inhabited Bellerophon is arid and inhospitable, and conflicts over limited agricultural resources are common.

column2: Recently liberated from mercenaries and religious fanatics, lightly-inhabited Bellerophon is arid and inhospitable, and conflicts over limited agricultural resources are common.

column2: Archaeologists have determined that Bellevue was once a vibrant Terran-like planet with a pre-spaceflight indiginous population, but the ecosystem was destroyed by unknown means.  Many ruins dot the planet.

column2: Belluevue was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

column2: Benedict is a fairly typical planet, notable only for a small cadre of religious fanatics who inhabit a large monastery on the northern continent, and for being a regional trade hub.

column2: The Benet system was colonized at some point during or shortly before the Age of War. Benet III was settled in order to take advantage of the metals in the world's crust. These metals are largely platinum and related metals.
column3: The Benet system was colonized at some point during or shortly before the Age of War. Benet III was settled in order to take advantage of the metals in the world's crust. These metals are largely platinum and related metals.

column2: Notable for the Benfled Cadet Academy and a highly diverse ecosystem compatible with Human life, Benfled has long been a peaceful \"breadbasket\" planet of the Lyran Commonwealth.
column3: Notable for the Benfled Cadet Academy and a highly diverse ecosystem compatible with Human life, Benfled has long been a peaceful "breadbasket" planet of the Lyran Commonwealth.

column2: First colonised during the Terran Exodus, Benjamin has long supported a strong petrochemical and manufacturing industry, and a self-sufficient agricultral base.  Poor environmental practices have lead to the atmosphere becoming tainted.
column3: First colonised during the Terran Exodus, Benjamin has long supported a strong petrochemical and manufacturing industry, and a self-sufficient agricultral base. Poor environmental practices have lead to the atmosphere becoming tainted.

column2: Although Bensinger has been part of the Commonwealth for nearly 300 years, the planet has always had the undertone of rebellion since the days of the Rimworld Republic.  Otherwise, it is a self-sufficient world with a moderate manufacturing base.

column2: Officially listed as \"marginally habitable\", Bentley is an ice-bound world who's population centres cluster around a barely habitable equatorial band, an a few geothermal hotspots.
column3: Officially listed as "marginally habitable", Bentley is an ice-bound world who's population centres cluster around a barely habitable equatorial band, an a few geothermal hotspots.

column3: Beowulf was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

column2: Benenson is a world with a turbulent past.  Up until some 200 years ago, the planet changed hands so frequently that even some historical documents can't agree on who held it at carious times.
column3: Benenson is a world with a turbulent past. Up until some 200 years ago, the planet changed hands so frequently that even some historical documents can't agree on who held it at carious times.

column2: Bergen is one of the worlds that form a part of the Deep Periphery nation known as the Hanseatic League, exporting goods to other Hanseatic worlds.
column3: Bergen is one of the worlds that form a part of the Deep Periphery nation known as the Hanseatic League, exporting goods to other Hanseatic worlds.

column2: A fairly marginal border world, recently retaken from the Feds.  Bergman's only real claim to fame is it's hostile environment and ecosystem, and the existance of a smallish prison for some of the Combine's political prisoners.
column3: A fairly marginal border world, recently retaken from the Feds. Bergman's only real claim to fame is it's hostile environment and ecosystem, and the existance of a smallish prison for some of the Combine's political prisoners.

column2: On Bergtatt, a sand-sharp wind has cut mountains into howling arches and singing spires, and the endless noise makes long-term residence impossible. It also makes the planet difficult to scan, which mean it has a steady population of short-term residents on the run.
column3: On Bergtatt, a sand-sharp wind has cut mountains into howling arches and singing spires, and the endless noise makes long-term residence impossible. It also makes the planet difficult to scan, which mean it has a steady population of short-term residents on the run.

column2: As a system originally colonized in the initial exodus from Terra, this rough backwater is easily forgotten.  Small and rocky, the majority of the population is comprised of a single large spaceport and a one-way prison for political dissidents.

column3: The largest agricultural planet within the Lyran Commonwealth, Bountiful Harvest has huge tracts of flat and arable lands and two large oceans, the entire word an agricultural haven able to support its own needs as well as neighboring systems.

column2: Bowang was a major trading hub within the Free Worlds League during the Succession Wars. The planetary leaders, recognizing their ideal position, encouraged a stance of neutrality in all business and political dealings.
column3: Bowang was a major trading hub within the Free Worlds League during the Succession Wars. The planetary leaders, recognizing their ideal position, encouraged a stance of neutrality in all business and political dealings.

column3: Brabent was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

column2: Once described as \"Not Hell, but you can see it from here\", the large Martian like planet Brailsford would never have been colonised if it were not for it's masive mineral reserves.  It also now contains one of the Combine's largest jails.
column3: Once described as "Not Hell, but you can see it from here", the large Martian like planet Brailsford would never have been colonised if it were not for it's masive mineral reserves. It also now contains one of the Combine's largest jails.

column3: Branzoll was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

column2: Arriving in the early twenty-sixth century, the first settlers established the city of Alaikum, which would survive both the Reunification War and the decline of the Star League, becoming a center of Shi'ite scholarship and learning.
column3: Arriving in the early twenty-sixth century, the first settlers established the city of Alaikum, which would survive both the Reunification War and the decline of the Star League, becoming a center of Shi'ite scholarship and learning.

column2: Braum was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.
column3: Braum was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

column2: Braunschweig is one of the worlds that form a part of the Deep Periphery nation known as the Hanseatic League, exporting goods to other Hanseatic worlds.
column3: Braunschweig is one of the worlds that form a part of the Deep Periphery nation known as the Hanseatic League, exporting goods to other Hanseatic worlds.

column2: One of the Combine's most productive breadbasket planets, Braunton acts as a trade hub for the local area as well.
column3: One of the Combine's most productive breadbasket planets, Braunton acts as a trade hub for the local area as well.

column2: Breed was invaded by the Eleventh Benjamin Regulars. Defending Breed were the Second Robinson Rangers. The campaign was still ongoing, with the Eleventh in control of the cities on Breed while the Rangers dominated the wilderness.
column3: Breed was invaded by the Eleventh Benjamin Regulars. Defending Breed were the Second Robinson Rangers. The campaign was still ongoing, with the Eleventh in control of the cities on Breed while the Rangers dominated the wilderness.

column2: Bremen is the capital world of the Hanseatic League, and contains the main houses of the large trading families aswell as the Council of Merchants.
column3: Bremen is the capital world of the Hanseatic League, and contains the main houses of the large trading families aswell as the Council of Merchants.

column2: Bremen (RW) was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.
column3: Bremen (RW) was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

column2: Bremond was liberated by the Armed Forces of the Federated Suns in 2798-9, in one of a wave of uncoordinated retaliatory attacks launched in response to the news about the Kentares Massacre, having been occupied by the Combine at some point in 2797.
column3: Bremond was liberated by the Armed Forces of the Federated Suns in 2798-9, in one of a wave of uncoordinated retaliatory attacks launched in response to the news about the Kentares Massacre, having been occupied by the Combine at some point in 2797.

column2: Brest was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.
column3: Brest was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

column2: Described as \"The happiest place in Lyran space\", Breukelen's native flaura release pollens that are mildly euphoric to humans.  This has resulted in a significant tourism industry, and a \"hippy\" culture on the planet.
column3: Described as "The happiest place in Lyran space", Breukelen's native flaura release pollens that are mildly euphoric to humans. This has resulted in a significant tourism industry, and a "hippy" culture on the planet.

column2: Brighton was originally settled by miners looking to exploit the copper and silver ores on the world. Brighton's other claim to fame is that it was the site of the only official Capellan political prison.
column3: Brighton was originally settled by miners looking to exploit the copper and silver ores on the world. Brighton's other claim to fame is that it was the site of the only official Capellan political prison.

column2: An otherwise unremarkable planet on the spinward edge of the Combine, Brihuega has become known as \"The planet of spies\" due to it's \"use\" as a training ground for Commonwealth agents operating out of Farstar.
column3: An otherwise unremarkable planet on the spinward edge of the Combine, Brihuega has become known as "The planet of spies" due to it's "use" as a training ground for Commonwealth agents operating out of Farstar.

column2: The Brim system is the location of a habitable world, Brim IV, and is located in the Deep Periphery region
column3: The Brim system is the location of a habitable world, Brim IV, and is located in the Deep Periphery region

column2: A lush, high-gravity world, Bringdam's atmosphere is so dense as to be almost unbreathable. The humidity makes it a poor location for mining, but it is an excellent agricultural world, supplying itself and a number of nearby systems.
column3: A lush, high-gravity world, Bringdam's atmosphere is so dense as to be almost unbreathable. The humidity makes it a poor location for mining, but it is an excellent agricultural world, supplying itself and a number of nearby systems.

column2: A lush, high-gravity world, Bringdam's atmosphere is so dense as to be almost unbreathable. The humidity makes it a poor location for mining, but it is an excellent agricultural world, supplying itself and a number of nearby systems.
column3: A lush, high-gravity world, Bringdam's atmosphere is so dense as to be almost unbreathable. The humidity makes it a poor location for mining, but it is an excellent agricultural world, supplying itself and a number of nearby systems.

column2: Brinton is an infamous world due to the plague that bears its name. Centuries ago the Capellans released a bio-weapon on the surface, which continues to be deadly even now. The target of numerous raids, Brinton is now heavily guarded by the Concordat.
column3: Brinton is an infamous world due to the plague that bears its name. Centuries ago the Capellans released a bio-weapon on the surface, which continues to be deadly even now. The target of numerous raids, Brinton is now heavily guarded by the Concordat.

column2: Brisbane is a beautiful ocean world with pristine white-sand beaches that conceal a deadly secret: a viral degenerative nerve disease with no cure. Those unlucky enough to contract it gradually lose the use of their limbs and muscles.
column3: Brisbane is a beautiful ocean world with pristine white-sand beaches that conceal a deadly secret: a viral degenerative nerve disease with no cure. Those unlucky enough to contract it gradually lose the use of their limbs and muscles.

column2: Colonised during the First Exodus from Terra, Bristol has always been a planet heavily geared towards manufacturing, although the ravages of the Succession Wars has reduced this to one significant arms maker - Jolassa-Kumbold Armored Weapons.
column3: Colonised during the First Exodus from Terra, Bristol has always been a planet heavily geared towards manufacturing, although the ravages of the Succession Wars has reduced this to one significant arms maker - Jolassa-Kumbold Armored Weapons.

column2: Brixtana is a cold world with windswept tundra and boreal forests. Once the site of an SLDF garrison, it was conquered early in the Reunification War despite dogged resistance by Magistracy-aligned mercenaries.
column3: Brixtana is a cold world with windswept tundra and boreal forests. Once the site of an SLDF garrison, it was conquered early in the Reunification War despite dogged resistance by Magistracy-aligned mercenaries.

column2: Broaddus is a temperate world, with large areas of grasslands ideal for the farming of cattle and other herbivores.  Coastal areas of this almost hillless planet form large areas of marshland, which should be avoided by heavy vehicles (and 'Mechs).
column3: Broaddus is a temperate world, with large areas of grasslands ideal for the farming of cattle and other herbivores. Coastal areas of this almost hillless planet form large areas of marshland, which should be avoided by heavy vehicles (and 'Mechs).

column2: Brocchi's Cluster contains what appears to be the remnants of a large planet in the \"green zone\" of this Class M star, which at some point has exploded into a large asteroid belt.  Over 40 inhabited planetoids and constructs exist in the area.
column3: Brocchi's Cluster contains what appears to be the remnants of a large planet in the "green zone" of this Class M star, which at some point has exploded into a large asteroid belt. Over 40 inhabited planetoids and constructs exist in the area.

column2: Brockton is a planet of small settlements and vast untouched wilderness.  The local flora has adapted to cope with the underground fungus that exists across the planet, however this fungal growth makes traditional farming almost impossible.
column3: Brockton is a planet of small settlements and vast untouched wilderness. The local flora has adapted to cope with the underground fungus that exists across the planet, however this fungal growth makes traditional farming almost impossible.

column2: A rugged, harsh world, Brockway was colonized only due to its rich mineral resources. Originally held by the Concordat, the planet was seized by the Federated Suns after the Reunification War and has been a Davion holding ever since.
column3: A rugged, harsh world, Brockway was colonized only due to its rich mineral resources. Originally held by the Concordat, the planet was seized by the Federated Suns after the Reunification War and has been a Davion holding ever since.

column2: Broken Wheel is a Fed planet on the edge of the Inner Sphere, unremarkable save for the extensive repair and refit facilities that dot the planet.
column3: Broken Wheel is a Fed planet on the edge of the Inner Sphere, unremarkable save for the extensive repair and refit facilities that dot the planet.

column2: The arid world of Bromhead was settled in the first wave of colonization, and was a Taurian holding until the Reunification War. It is now a Davion possession, with a large population in sprawling river-bank cities that nestle in the vast deserts.
column3: The arid world of Bromhead was settled in the first wave of colonization, and was a Taurian holding until the Reunification War. It is now a Davion possession, with a large population in sprawling river-bank cities that nestle in the vast deserts.

column2: A major mining and refining planet for the Feds, Brookeland also has a bright Type O star which makes it favoured as a recharge point for jump routes.
column3: A major mining and refining planet for the Feds, Brookeland also has a bright Type O star which makes it favoured as a recharge point for jump routes.

column2: Another \"Breadbasket\" world deep in Lyran territory, Brooloo is a laid back world of large farms untouched by conflict.
column3: Another "Breadbasket" world deep in Lyran territory, Brooloo is a laid back world of large farms untouched by conflict.

column2: Brownsville was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.
column3: Brownsville was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

column2: A former Combine planet recently annexed by the FRR, Bruben is notable only in the fact that it is (more-or-less) self sufficient, with a balanced mix of agriculture and manufacturing.
column3: A former Combine planet recently annexed by the FRR, Bruben is notable only in the fact that it is (more-or-less) self sufficient, with a balanced mix of agriculture and manufacturing.

column2: Bruges is one of the worlds that form a part of the Deep Periphery nation known as the Hanseatic League, exporting goods to other Hanseatic worlds.
column3: Bruges is one of the worlds that form a part of the Deep Periphery nation known as the Hanseatic League, exporting goods to other Hanseatic worlds.

column2: Brundage is a desert world with vast mountain ranges, that can barely support it's own population.  Recent rumours of a lost Star League cache has brought treasure seekers to the world, who have so far found nothing.
column3: Brundage is a desert world with vast mountain ranges, that can barely support it's own population. Recent rumours of a lost Star League cache has brought treasure seekers to the world, who have so far found nothing.

column2: No data exists for this planet.  Orbital scans show no significant settlement, or life for that matter.
column3: No data exists for this planet. Orbital scans show no significant settlement, or life for that matter.

column2: Brusett is a typical backwater farming planet, near the border with the Taurean Concordant.  Rural, and boring.
column3: Brusett is a typical backwater farming planet, near the border with the Taurean Concordant. Rural, and boring.

column2: Bryant was the subject of an early terraforming project which succeeded. Unfortunately the satelites which stabilized Bryant's changed climate were destroyed during the Amaris Civil War and the climate has now returned to its original hostile state.
column3: Брайант участвовал в одном из первых проектов терраформирования который стал успешным. К сожалению, спутники, которые стабилизировали изменившийся климат Брайанта, были уничтожены во время гражданской войны Амариса, и теперь климат вернулся в исходное неблагоприятное состояние.

column2: Originally settled by the Outworlds Alliance, Bryceland was ceded to the Combine in 2585, before being lost to the Feds during the Second Succession War.  Bryceland remains home to several Battlemech plants.
column3: Originally settled by the Outworlds Alliance, Bryceland was ceded to the Combine in 2585, before being lost to the Feds during the Second Succession War. Bryceland remains home to several Battlemech plants.

column2: Buchlau was settled for its fish. The planet only has a single continent, Vienna, which is surrounded by a massive ocean. This ocean is teeming with life.
column3: Buchlau was settled for its fish. The planet only has a single continent, Vienna, which is surrounded by a massive ocean. This ocean is teeming with life.

column2: Bucklands - the planet that should have been called Farmlands.  Almost every inch of landmass on this planet is farmed to take advantage of it's hightly arible soil.
column3: Bucklands - the planet that should have been called Farmlands. Almost every inch of landmass on this planet is farmed to take advantage of it's hightly arible soil.

column2: Buckminster is a regional capital in the Combine, and remains one of it's most important agriculture and production planets.  Only recently has the Second Sword of Light moved off-planet, leaving it's defence to the 7th and 8th Alshain Regulars.
column3: Buckminster is a regional capital in the Combine, and remains one of it's most important agriculture and production planets. Only recently has the Second Sword of Light moved off-planet, leaving it's defence to the 7th and 8th Alshain Regulars.

column2: Budingen is a minor mining and manufacturing planet, plagues by brutal storms and frigid winters.  It's importance is more for it's proximity to the Outworld Alliance than it's actual worth.
column3: Budingen is a minor mining and manufacturing planet, plagues by brutal storms and frigid winters. It's importance is more for it's proximity to the Outworld Alliance than it's actual worth.

column2: In 3020 the Lyran Commonwealth Armed Forces opened the War College of Buena, a military academy that specialized in training MechWarriors and teaching Maintenance Sciences.  Beyond that, the planet is basically mediteranian style farms.
column3: In 3020 the Lyran Commonwealth Armed Forces opened the War College of Buena, a military academy that specialized in training MechWarriors and teaching Maintenance Sciences. Beyond that, the planet is basically mediteranian style farms.

column2: This agricultural world has been the target of repeated Marik attempts to conquer it. To protect its food production, most farms were moved underground or to hydroponic offshore platforms. The planet's capital, also called Buenos Aires, is a teeming metropolis of millions.
column3: This agricultural world has been the target of repeated Marik attempts to conquer it. To protect its food production, most farms were moved underground or to hydroponic offshore platforms. The planet's capital, also called Buenos Aires, is a teeming metropolis of millions.

column2: Burnt Rock was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.
column3: Burnt Rock was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

column2: Burton is a company world, the home of one of the largest Taurian electronics manufacturers. Most of the world's small population consists of employees, staff, and support services for O-P Computer Electronics.
